title: Ordering of powers of $$x$$
text: The first step in finding the standard form of the equation is to rearrange the $$x$$ terms in decreasing order based on their exponents.

title: Reordered Terms
text: What equation do we get when the terms are reordered so the largest power of $$x$$ is first and the rest follow in decreasing order?

title: Complete the Square
text: The standard form includes a constant added or subtracted to the $$x$$ term within the exponent parentheses. The constant is equal to $$\frac{1}{2}$$ of the coefficient of the $$x$$ term.

title: Complete the Square
text: What binomial will be part of the standard form of this quadratic?

title: Accounting for constant term
text: Once the binomial is expanded out, a constant is usually required to match the constant term of the original equation.

title: Solving for the constant
text: The binomial expansion leads to a constant of $$9$$. The original equation has a constant of $$13$$.

title: Accounting for Difference
text: What do we need to add to get from $$9$$ to $$13$$ outside of the binomial term to complete the standard form?
